li.class: sub-menu-columns menu-item menu-item-type-post_type menu-item-object-page menu-item-has-children menu-item-38

li.a: Strategic Planning – Vision of the Learner

div.p: As you are aware Canterbury Public School will not be providing remote learning activities, April 10th, and April 13-17. This is an update for you concerning the spring break time.
Please know we are very concerned about you and your families at this time. Stay healthy and we will continue to provide communication to you on an ongoing basis.

ul.li: Windham County and New London County currently has the fewest cases of COVID 19 than the rest of Connecticut. Currently there are two (2) positive cases in the Town of Canterbury. The only effective way to stop the spread of COVID-19 is to act as though everyone is infected. This also includes protecting yourself from members of your household who are exhibiting symptoms. Stay home as much as possible, practice proper handwashing and hygiene, practice strict social distancing of at least 6 feet if you must be out in public and around other people, and follow the CDC recommendation to wear cloth face coverings in public settings to slow the spread of the virus.

Emphasize to your children the importance of avoiding gatherings of any size, including in public spaces and in private homes. Children should not be having face to face playdates or gathering in basketball courts or in groups of any kind. However, it is important to stay connected with friends and family, whether it be by phone calls, video chats or via social media.

We understand that this is a stressful time for many people. Social distancing can feel quite isolating. Please reach out to a friend or loved one to talk through these stressors. There are also many resources (parenting, financial, mental health among many others) available by calling 211 or going to 211ct.org.

We at Canterbury Public Schools care deeply, not just about your child’s academics but also about the well-being of you and your family. We want to see all of our Canterbury families through this difficult time with healthy bodies and minds. Please feel free to reach out to our school nurses if you have any questions or concerns. kjodoin@canterburypublicschools.org, castimson@canterburypublicschools.org
The Canterbury “remote learning model” will continue on Monday, April 20th.
“Grab & Go” meal program will continue through the spring break. Distribution and pick-up will be Monday, Wednesday, and Friday during next week.

Our district website, canterburypublicschools.org is the only site that will be providing official information concerning Canterbury Public Schools. You will also receive emails and other information electronically from our two schools and central office departments. These are three additional websites to access form additional information: www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/summary.html, www.nddh.org. and www.who.int.

div.p:
James A. Connelly
Interim Superintendent of Schools
45 Westminster Road, Canterbury, CT 06331
Phone (860) 546-6950 Fax (860) 546-6423
jconnelly@canterburypublicschools.org

div.p: Please check with Canterbury Elementary School and Dr. Helen Baldwin Middle School pages for school specific information.

h2.strong: It’s Okay to Need Help in a Time Like This

p.span: At Canterbury Public Schools, we understand the impact of the pandemic on families. We know the impact may be financial, emotional, health, and so much more. We are here to help. Please reach out to any of the following three Pupil Services staff to discuss your needs:

If the adults, families or children in your life prefer to access counseling outside of school, please refer to the list below for providers accepting new clients over telehealth during the pandemic, and within a 20 minute drive of Canterbury:

td.span: Healing Hoofbeats (Parent Support Group specific to pandemic)

p.span: line is always available to provide support in a crisis, linking you to resources for basic necessities, and additional therapy options. Simply dial 211; choose from options for crisis intervention; children’s services; food, housing, utility assistance or help with any other basic needs. You will be connected to help in our area.

for further information on remote learning plans.
